articles.title: What happens next after the Supreme Court slapped down Trump’s tariffs
articles.description:
Trump described the justices as “fools and lapdogs” who are “very unpatriotic and disloyal to our Constitution.”

The post What happens next after the Supreme Court slapped down Trump’s tariffs appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Supreme Court rejected Trump's tariffs, impacting local businesses reliant on imported goods.
Tariffs previously affected over $300 billion in imports, raising costs for Boston consumers.
Local manufacturers may see reduced prices, benefiting Boston's economy and consumers.

articles.title: Murky outlook for businesses after tariff ruling prompts countermoves by Trump
articles.description:
Within hours of the court's decision, Trump pledged to use a different law to impose a 10% tariff on all imports that would last 150 days.

The post Murky outlook for businesses after tariff ruling prompts countermoves by Trump appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Trump plans a 10% tariff on all imports for 150 days following a court ruling.
Local businesses in Boston may face increased costs and supply chain disruptions.
The tariff could lead to higher prices for consumers and reduced spending in the area.

articles.title: Nearly 3.4 million pounds of recalled Trader Joe’s chicken fried rice products may contain glass
articles.description:
Ajinomoto Foods North America Inc. pulled Trader Joe's Chicken Fried Rice from stores nationwide.

The post Nearly 3.4 million pounds of recalled Trader Joe’s chicken fried rice products may contain glass appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Ajinomoto Foods recalled 3.4 million pounds of Trader Joe's Chicken Fried Rice due to glass contamination.
The recall affects products sold nationwide, including locations in Boston.
Residents should check their freezers and return affected products for a refund.

articles.title: She’s running Boston so children like her daughter get access to healthcare
articles.description:
Jordan Whitaker is running the 2026 Boston Marathon for Mass. Eye and Ear.

The post She’s running Boston so children like her daughter get access to healthcare appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Jordan Whitaker is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to support Mass. Eye and Ear.
Her efforts aim to improve healthcare access for children like her daughter.
The initiative highlights local healthcare challenges faced by Boston families.
